Name: Daiquiri No.2 (El Floridita style)
Ingredients: 60 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
7.5 ml Dutch Cacao white crème de cacao
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Review: Like other Daiquiris, this complex version benefits from dilution so consider adding a dash of water.
History: The origins of this Daiquiri No. 2 with vermouth and crème de cacao are unknown. Although subtitled "El Floridita-style," this cocktail should not be confused with the Daiquiri No. 2 created by Constantino "Constante" Ribalaïgua Vert, who owned Havana's famous El Floridita from 1918 to 1952. See: Daiquiri cocktail history
Nutrition: One serving of Daiquiri No.2 (El Floridita style) contains 185 calories
